summary: This is a search warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the search of Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street. The warrant seeks evidence related to violations of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, specifically targeting electronic devices and media containing communications, photos, and records related to victims and the offenses. It was issued by Magistrate Judge Henry Pitman and executed by law enforcement.

persons.name: Henry Pitman
persons.context: Issued the search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, authorizing the search and seizure of evidence related to sex trafficking offenses.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution Deadline
events.description: The search warrant commanded execution on or before this date, authorizing law enforcement to search Epstein's New York residence for evidence of sex trafficking.

events.title: Search Warrant Issuance
events.description: Magistrate Judge Henry Pitman issued the search warrant for 9 East 71st Street, New York, based on probable cause for violations of sex trafficking statutes.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The search warrant targets Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street for evidence of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The warrant specifically authorizes seizure of electronic devices and storage media containing communications, photos, and records related to victims and potential victims.
Violations cited are Title 18, United States Code, Sections 371 (conspiracy) and 1591 (sex trafficking of minors).
The warrant allows for forensic imaging of devices and detailed review techniques, including keyword searches and recovery of deleted data.
The warrant was issued by Magistrate Judge Henry Pitman and had an execution deadline of July 12, 2019.
